Posts.Content: I'm fifty. I had the CT scan back in July but nothing was mentioned about the results. To be honest, I forgot to ask about it after the cytoscopy because I was floored by the result. Thanks for your help. I'm waiting to hear back and schedule the biopsy.
Posts.Title: Fifty, Asymmetric prostate and a 1.1 PSA

Posts.Content: Finally had the biopsy done. Here are the findings at the time: "Findings: Prostatic volume was noted to be __28___ cc. While prostatic WIDTH:_4.7____mm; HEIGHT:_29____mm; LENGTH:_41.5____mm. The prostate revealed no evidence of hypo or hyperechogenicity suggestive of prostatic pathology. However there was asymmetrical growth of the right lobe that appeared to impinge into the prostatic urethra. Capsular margins appeared to be intact with well defined seminal vesicle-prostate margins as well as apical-membranous urethral margins. Seminal vesicles appeared to be normal bilaterally. Impression: ASYMMETRICAL GROWTH OF RIGHT LOBE OF THE PROSTATE. Now I wait until the 21st for the results.
Posts.Title: Fifty, Asymmetric prostate and a 1.1 PSA

Posts.Content: I came down with what was initially diagnosed as urethritis this spring (urethra pain, urge to urinate, etc etc.) After several rounds of antibiotics my symptoms had all but subsided. But since symptoms were still lingering my Urologist scheduled me for a CT scan and cystoscopy just in case. He gave me a DRE back in June, but didn't mention anything abnormal. I had the cystoscopy on the 15th of September and he found the asymmetrical growth of my prostate which is impinging on my urethra, which may have caused my previous urethritis symptoms. (actual diagnosis: The prostatic urethra reveals an unusual growth of right lobe that is completely obstructing the urethra. The left lobe and the median lobe are normal in size and caliber.) My PSA has been 1.1 since 2009 and was the same when I tested in August. Given my age and my fathers history with PC my Dr. suggested a biopsy to rule out cancer. That was the last thing I thought I'd have to deal with. It sounds more like Prostatitis to me, but what do I know? Anyone have any input??
Posts.Title: Fifty, Asymmetric prostate and a 1.1 PSA

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F 2) Have you had the CT scan yet? Spoke to my Dr yesterday and he said "The CT scan was normal. No abnormalities were noted. That is excellent news."
